To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: The recording is of a variety of clips featuring Minnie Pearl's comedy routines. The various stand up recordings feature: Ernest Tubb (musician), Rod Brasfield (comedian), Grant Turner (musician), Hank Snow (musician), Jimmie Dickens (musician), and Ray Price (musician). The recordings are labeled disc number one, two, three, and four. The recordings are believed to take place at the Grand Ole Opry. The first recording is from May of 1952. The second recording is from the Spring of 1955. The remaining recordings are from a number of unidentified dates.

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
